member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Start date of the analysis. If null, no lower limit is considered.
End date of the analysis. If null, no upper limit is considered.

member.summary: Gets the exam being analyzed.

member.summary: Gets the start date of the analysis.

member.summary: Gets the responses being analyzed.

member.summary: Gets the amount of responses that were analyzed.

member.summary: Gets the average grade for the responses being analyzed.

member.name: P:DiagnosticoDeMatematicas.Helpers.ExamAnalyzer.GradeRanges
member.summary: Gets an array containing the percentage of responses that fall within a certain grade range, starting in 0 and ending in 100, in intervals of 5.

member.name: P:DiagnosticoDeMatematicas.Helpers.ExamAnalyzer.QuestionResponses
member.summary: Gets the dictionary containing the amount of times each option was chosen for a given question. The key is the ID of the question, and the value is a tuple containing the amount of times optionA, optionB, optionC, and OptionD were chosen, respectively.

member.name: M:DiagnosticoDeMatematicas.Helpers.ExamAnalyzer.PercentageBetweenGrades(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the percentage of the responses analyzed that have a grade within the limits specified.
member.param: Inclusive lower limit of the range of grades.
Non-inclusive upper limit of the range of grades.
member.returns: The percentage of responses meeting the criteria.

member.summary: Creates the QuestionResponses dictionary.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the exam to which this question belongs.

member.name: P:DiagnosticoDeMatematicas.Models.Question.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the question. This field can be interpreted as a Latex mathematical formula, and can contain both variables (Identified by a '%', e.g. "%x") and expressions that should be evaluated (Identified by surrounding '|', e.g. "|2+3|"). Also, it can contain chart definitions. For more information on defining charts, read the documentation on Helpers.Charts.ChartBuilder.
